intro: Albuca gariepensis, commonly known as the Gariep bulb, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its compact, rosette-forming leaves. The plant produces upright, slender flowering stems that bear small, white or pale green flowers. It is adapted to arid environments and requires well-drained soil. Albuca gariepensis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
